title: AMG Fans Win: Mercedes May Ditch Disappointing 4-Cylinder for Inline-Six in Next C 63
description: The Mercedes-AMG C 63 S E Performance is an engineering tour de force, boasting a plug-in hybrid powertrain generating 671 horsepower and 752 pound-feet of torque. But the internal-combustion part of that powertrain—a turbocharged 2.0-liter inline-four—has disappointed fans used to the old C 63's ...

descriptionSummary: The Mercedes-AMG C 63 S E Performance showcases remarkable engineering, pairing a potent plug-in hybrid system with a high-revving 2.0L four-cylinder engine producing 671 horsepower and 752 lb-ft of torque. However, its smaller displacement has left some enthusiasts underwhelmed.

title: Very Special 2009 Bentley Azure for Sale With Just 1,800 Miles
description: Finding a barely used luxury car is rare enough, but discovering a 2009 Bentley Azure with only 1,800 miles on the odometer is like stumbling upon treasure. title: Mexico Raises Tariffs on Chinese Cars to 50%, Balancing U.S. Pressure and Industry Protection
description: Mexico is moving to raise tariffs on Chinese-built vehicles to as high as 50%, a significant hike from current rates in the 15–20% range. Officials say the new measures are part of a broad industrial strategy aimed at protecting domestic jobs and manufacturers. But observers note the timing is also ...
titleSummary: Mexico Slaps Higher Tariffs on China-Car Imports, Walking Fine Line Between Trade and Industry Interests
descriptionSummary: Mexico plans to drastically increase tariffs on Chinese-built vehicles, potentially up to 50%, as part of a broader effort to shield domestic industries and preserve jobs. The move aims to support local manufacturers but has raised eyebrows about its strategic motives.

title: Toyota’s Long-Rumored GRMN Corolla Emerges in a Dealer Event
description: Reports of a more extreme Toyota Corolla have circulated for some time. Earlier this year, talk of a GRMN-badged model gained traction, suggesting Toyota's Gazoo Racing division was preparing something beyond the GR Corolla already on sale. descriptionSummary: Rumors have been swirling about an even more potent Toyota Corolla, potentially bearing the badge of Toyota's high-performance Gazoo Racing division, which could indicate a more aggressive and lightweight driving experience.

title: Why You Can Hear EVs Coming But Can't Find Them Fast Enough
description: You’re at a busy crossing. Three electric cars roll in quietly. You hear a polite electronic hum, maybe a soft beep. Your ears say “car nearby,” but your eyes don’t know where to look. That brief pause is the risk. Today’s warning sounds make EVs audible at low speed; they don’t always help you ...
titleSummary: The Silent Invasion: Electric Cars Make Themselves Heard but Hard to Track.
descriptionSummary: At a crowded intersection, electric vehicles glide in with a gentle whir and subtle tone, creating a temporary disconnect between auditory cues and visual awareness - a fleeting moment of uncertainty for drivers.

title: Forget the S-Class: The New Mercedes-Benz VLS Is in a League of Its Own
description: The Mercedes-Benz S-Class has long been the pinnacle of automotive luxury, so influential that Mercedes eventually extended it into a two-door coupe and a sprawling SUV called the GLS. descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz's storied S-Class has redefined luxury, spawning variants like the sleek coupe and spacious GLS SUV. Now, the brand is pushing the boundaries of opulence with the revolutionary VLS, a bold new take on automotive refinement.

title: Audi's RS6 e-tron Dream Dies, But the V8 Wagon Lives On
description: Audi has quietly walked back its plans to build the RS6 e-tron, the all-electric performance wagon once hyped as the shining EV centerpiece of the RS lineup. descriptionSummary: Audi has quietly shelved plans for the RS6 e-tron, a high-performance electric wagon that was once touted as a flagship EV model for the brand. It appears the market didn't quite align with the company's initial enthusiasm.

descriptionSummary: Honda's American electrification strategy has been sluggish, with some initiatives needing outside assistance. However, the brand excels globally, as evidenced by the recently unveiled N-One E – an unconventional, electric mini-car that showcases its innovative spirit overseas.

title: Honda and Acura Sales Stumble In August, Prologue Shines Bright
description: Both new and used vehicle prices have risen rather quickly over the past four years, and they’re showing no signs of stopping. title: Automotive Journalists Save Puppies! What is Operation Frodo?
description: Operation Frodo is more than a road trip; it’s part of a growing effort to rescue dogs from uncertain futures and deliver them to loving homes thousands of miles away. title: Ferrari’s Tribute to America After 9/11 Remains One of F1’s Most Powerful Gestures

Michael Schumacher and Rubens Barrichello raced in all-red cars stripped of sponsor ...

descriptionSummary: On September 11, 2001, global shockwaves extended far beyond America's shores. Five days later, at the Italian Grand Prix, Ferrari used its Formula 1 cars as a poignant tribute to solidarity, racing in all-red vehicles devoid of sponsorship decals.

title: Nissan Says It Could Fix Traffic By Making Everyone Go The Same Speed
